ls with Wilson disease, copper deposits in the front surface of the eye (the cornea) form a green-to-brownish ring, called the Kayser-Fleischer ring, that surrounds the colored part of the eye. Abnormalities in eye movements, such as a restricted ability to gaze upwards, may also occur.",GHR,Wilson disease
How many people are affected by Wilson disease ?,"Wilson disease is a rare disorder that affects approximately 1 in 30,000 individuals.",GHR,Wilson disease
